week0.question: Which of the following allows us to identify objects and extract information?
week0.solution: RFID Technology allows us to automatically identify and track tags that are attached to the objects. It extracts information from the tags through electromagnetic fields. See lecture 1 @ 12:57

week0.question: How many layers does Zigbee consist of?
week0.solution: Zigbee consists of 4 layers: Physical, Medium Access Control, Network, and Application. See lecture 48 @ 16:11

week0.question: Which of the following is not a component of cloud computing?
week0.solution: Cloud computing components include clients, services, applications, platform, storage, and infrastructure. See lecture 37 @ 23:29

week0.question: Which of the following is a distance measuring sensor module?
week0.solution: HC-SR04 is the distance measuring module ultrasonic sensor, which measures the distance between 2cm~450cm. See lecture 3 @ 5:00

week0.question: Which of the following is a component in a typical sensor network?
week0.solution: A typical sensor network comprises of sensor nodes, routers, gateway, and sink.

week0.question: Which of the following sensors are responsible for measuring orientation and angular velocity?
week0.solution: A gyroscope is responsible for measuring orientation and angular velocity. See lecture 59 @ 15:41

week0.question: "ISA 100.11A" is a wireless networking technology standard. ISA stands for
week0.solution: ISA100.11a is a wireless networking technology standard developed by the International Society of Automation (ISA). See lecture 13@ 15:55

week0.question: Which of the following is not a difference between traditional data center and cloud computing?
week0.solution: Major differences between traditional data center and cloud computing include scalability, flexibility, elasticity, automation, running costs, and security. See lecture 39 @ 11:02

week0.question: Smart grid is also known as the energy internet.
week0.solution: Smart grid is also known as the energy internet. See lecture 51 @ 7:51

week0.question: Can a point of node failure result in the partition of the network in the stationary sensor network?
week0.solution: If there is a failure in the stationary sensor network then it is likely that the point of failure can partition the network into two or more fragments. See lecture 18 @ 01:10

week1.question: What is the full form of IoT?
week1.solution: The full form of IoT is "Internet of Things". See lecture 1 (Introduction to IoT - Part I) @ 1:30

week1.question: Which of the following technologies have unified and has resulted in the evolution of IoT?
week1.solution: Unification of technologies which has resulted in the advancement of IoT are a. Low-power embedded systems b. Cloud Computing c. Big Data d. Machine Learning e. Networking. See lecture 1 (Introduction to IoT - Part I) @ 5:54

week1.question: Which of the following are the enablers of IoT?
week1.solution: The enables of IoT are - a. RFID b. Nanotechnology c. Sensors d. Smart Networks. See lecture 2 (Introduction to IoT - Part I) @ 12:50

week1.question: Which of the following is/are a function of an IoT Gateway?
options: Connects the IoT LAN to a WAN
Can implement several LAN and WAN
Forwards packets between LAN and WAN on the IP layer
week1.solution: The functionalities of an IoT Gateway are a. Connects the IoT LAN to a WAN b. Can implement several LAN and WAN c. Forwards packets between LAN and WAN on the IP layer. See lecture 2 (Introduction to IoT - Part - II) @ 3:09

week1.question: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: "The same address of an IoT device may be repeated in the domain of another gateway. The gateway has a unique network prefix, which can be used to identify them globally."
week1.solution: The same address of an IoT device may be repeated in the domain of another gateway. The gateway has a unique network prefix, which can be used to identify them globally. See lecture 2 (Introduction to IoT - Part II) @ 07:00

week1.question: In ___ a node/network is connected to multiple networks for improved reliability.
week1.solution: In multi-homing, a node/network is connected to multiple networks for improved reliability. See lecture 2 (Introduction to IoT - Part II) @ 15:22

week1.question: The IPv4 notation uses ___ number of bits to represent an address.
week1.solution: The IPv4 notation uses 32 bits to represent an address. See lecture 2 (Introduction to IoT - Part - II) @ 16:33

week1.question: The "Source Address" field in the IPv6 header is of ___ bits in length.
week1.solution: The IPv6 header uses 128 bits to represent the "Source Address". See lecture 2 (Introduction to IoT - Part - II) @ 18:03

week1.question: A device which detects or measures a physical property and records, indicates, or otherwise responds to it is called ___?
week1.solution: A device which detects or measures a physical property and records, indicates, or otherwise responds to it is called a sensor. See lecture 3 (Sensing) @ 03:28

week1.question: A microphone is an example of an
week1.solution: A microphone is an example of an input device and transducer. See lecture 3 (Sensing) @ 10:31

week1.question: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: A sensor is only sensitive to the measured property for which it has been made (e.g., A temperature sensor senses the ambient temperature of a room.)
week1.solution: A sensor is only sensitive to the measured property (e.g., A temperature sensor senses the ambient temperature of a room.) See lecture 3 (Sensing) @ 12:11

week1.question: Based on the data type, sensors are classified as
week1.solution: Based on the data type, sensors are classified as Scalar and Vector/Multimedia. See lecture 3 (Sensing) @ 13:05

week1.question: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: The more the resolution of a sensor, the less accurate its precision.
week1.solution: The more the resolution of a sensor, the more accurate its precision. See lecture 3 (Sensing) @ 12:46

week1.question: The sensitivity of a sensor under real conditions may differ from the value specified. This is called
week1.solution: The sensitivity of a sensor under real conditions may differ from the value specified. See lecture 3 (Sensitivity error) @ 20:56

week1.question: A sensor node is made up of which of the following?
week1.solution: A sensor node is made up of a combination of sensor/sensors, a processor unit, a radio unit, and a power unit. See Page number 101, Chapter 5, Book Introduction to IoT...

week2.question: The full form of MQTT is
week2.solution: The full form of MQTT is Message Queue Telemetry Transport. See lecture 6 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part II) @ 01:51

week2.question: In MQTT, a ___ controls the publish-subscribe messaging pattern.
week2.solution: In MQTT, a message broker controls the publish-subscribe messaging pattern. See lecture 6 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part II) @ 03:33

week2.question: Which of the following is NOT a Data Protocol in IoT?
week2.solution: The data protocols in IoT are - a) MQTT b) COAP c) AMQP d) Websocket. See lecture 6 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part II) @ 01:16

week2.question: In MQTT for IoT, the Publishers are
week2.solution: In MQTT, the Publishers are lightweight sensors. See lecture 6 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part II) @ 04:49

week2.question: Which of the following is NOT a method in MQTT?
week2.solution: Following are the methods in MQTT - a. Connect b. Disconnect c. Subscribe d. Unsubscribe e. Publish. See lecture 6 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part II) @ 06:18

week2.question: Which of the following protocols in IoT have been designed for Machine to Machine (M2M) applications such as smart energy and building automation?
week2.solution: CoAP has been designed for Machine to Machine (M2M) applications such as smart energy and building automation. See lecture 7 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part III) @ 00:41

week2.question: Similar to HTTP, CoAP utilizes which of the following for operation?
week2.solution: Similar to HTTP, COAP utilizes GET, PUT, PUSH, DELETE message requests to retrieve, create, update, and delete, respectively. See lecture 7 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part III) @ 08:24

week2.question: What is the full form of XMPP in IoT?
week2.solution: XMPP stands for Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol. See lecture 7 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part III) @ 11:58

week2.question: State whether the following statement if True or False. Statement: XMPP is an open standard protocol.
week2.solution: XMPP is an open standard protocol. See lecture 7 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part III) @ 11:58

week2.question: What is the full form AMQP in context of IoT protocol?
week2.solution: AMQP stands for Advanced Message Queuing Protocol. See lecture 8 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part IV) @ 0:41

week2.question: What is the basic unit of data in the AMQP protocol?
week2.solution: In AMQP, the basic unit of data is called a frame. See lecture 8 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part IV) @ 0:41

week2.question: Which of the following is/are exchange types in AMQP?
week2.solution: The AMQP exchange types are a) Direct b) Fan-out c) Topic d) Header. See lecture 8 (Basics of IoT Networking - Part IV) @ 08:56

week2.question: IoT networks can be classified in which of the following type/types?
week2.solution: The IoT networks can be classified into two types such as i. Non-Beacon Enabled ii. Beacon Enabled. See lecture 9 (Connectivity Technologies - Part-I) @ 10:19

week2.question: The OSI model has ___ layers.
week2.solution: The OSI model is a conceptual framework that divides any networked communication system into seven layers. See Page number - 10, Chapter 1, Book - Introduction to IoT...

week2.question: The "Destination Address" in the IPv4 packet represents which of the following?
options: The destination node address of the packet
The intermediate hop in the network
week2.correctAnswer: The destination node address of the packet
week2.solution: The "Destination Address" in the IPv4 packet represents the address of the destination node in the network. See Page number 18, Chapter 1, Book - Introduction to IoT...

week3.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: There is no network layer in Wired HART
week3.solution: There is no network layer in Wired HART. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 05:22

week3.question: HART operates only in ___ GHz ISM band.
week3.solution: HART operates only in 2.4 GHz ISM band. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 05:43

week3.question: Super-frames in HART consist of grouped ___ wide timeslots.
week3.solution: Super-frames in HART consist of grouped 10ms wide timeslots. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 07:05

week3.question: The process of identifying channels consistently affected by interference and removing them from use is known as
week3.solution: Channel Blacklisting identifies channels consistently affected by interference and removes them from use. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 07:30

week3.question: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: Each node is supervised by the application manager and it guides them on when and where to send packets.
week3.solution: The Network manager supervises each node in the network and guides them on when and where to send packets. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 12:14

week3.question: FeliCa is commonly found in which country?
week3.solution: FeliCa is commonly found in Japan. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 17:52

week3.question: State whether the following state is true or false. Statement: NFC tags found in supermarket products are examples of passive NFC.
week3.solution: Passive NFC tags found in supermarket products are examples of passive NFC. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 18:47

week3.question: Active NFC devices are able to ___?
week3.solution: Active NFC devices are able to collect as well as transmit information. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 18:52

week3.question: A ___ in NFC emits a small electric current which creates a magnetic field that in turn bridges the physical space between the devices.
week3.solution: A reader in NFC emits a small electric current which creates a magnetic field that in turn bridges the physical space between the devices. See lecture 11 (Connectivity Technologies-III) @ 20:31

week3.question: Bluetooth technology is based on
week3.solution: Bluetooth technology is based on Ad-hoc technology. See lecture 12 (Connectivity Technologies-IV) @ 02:30

week3.question: Bluetooth technology operates in the unlicensed industrial, scientific and medical (ISM) band at ___ to ___ GHz.
week3.solution: Bluetooth technology operates in the unlicensed industrial, scientific and medical (ISM) band at 2.4 to 2.485 GHz. See lecture 12 (Connectivity Technologies-IV) @ 04:39

week3.question: Z-wave operates at ___ MHz in the US and ___ MHz in Europe.
week3.solution: Z-wave operates at 908.42 MHz in the US and 868.42 MHz in Europe. See lecture 13 (Connectivity Technologies-V) @ 3:40

week3.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Sensor nodes have limited battery life.
week3.solution: Sensors nodes have limited battery life. See lecture 14 (Sensor Networks-I) @ 13:15

week3.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: The Link Manager Protocol in Bluetooth manages the establishment, authentication, link configuration.
week3.solution: The Link Manager Protocol in Bluetooth manages the establishment, authentication, link configuration. See Page number 157, Chapter 7, Book - Introduction to IoT...

week3.question: Zigbee commonly uses ___ data rate.
week3.solution: Zigbee commonly uses 250 kbps data rate. See Page number-131, Chapter - 7, Book - Introduction to IoT...

week4.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Coverage in WSN is defined as the area-of-interest that is covered satisfactorily.
week4.solution: Coverage in WSN is defined as the area-of-interest that is covered satisfactorily. See lecture 17 (Sensor Networks-IV) @ 01:44

week4.question: If transmission range >= 2 * sensing range,
week4.solution: If transmission range >= 2* sensing range, coverage implies connectivity. See lecture 17 (Sensor Networks-IV) @ 04:14

week4.question: Forest fire monitoring in WSN is an example of which type of reporting?
week4.solution: Forest fire monitoring in WSN is an example of event driven reporting. See lecture 17 (Sensor Networks-IV) @ 08:13

week4.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Objective of coverage in WSN is to use minimum number of sensors and maximize network lifetime.
week4.solution: The objective of coverage in WSN is to use minimum number of sensors and maximize the network lifetime. See lecture 17 (Sensor Networks-IV) @ 08:47

week4.question: What is the full form of AUV in the context of mobile wireless sensor networks?
week4.solution: The full form of AUV is Autonomous Underwater Vehicle. See lecture 18 (Sensor Networks-V) @ 07:56

week4.question: In mobile wireless sensor networks, the sensor nodes are capable of ___ and measuring the condition of their surrounding environments.
week4.solution: In mobile wireless sensor networks, the sensor nodes are capable of collaborating with one another and measuring the condition of their surrounding environments. See lecture 18 (Sensor Networks-V) @ 04:56

week4.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: In mobile sensor networks, the sensor nodes come in close proximity of sink and deliver the data.
week4.solution: In mobile sensor networks, the sensor nodes come in close proximity of sink and deliver the data. See lecture 18 (Sensor Networks-V) @ 06:19

week4.question: Which of the following is/are a challenge/challenges in Human-centric Sensing?
week4.solution: The following are the challenges in human-centric sensing - a. Energy of devices b. Participant selection c. Privacy of users. See lecture 18 (Sensor Networks-V) @ 12:45

week4.question: Which of the following is/are a feature/features of UAV networks?
week4.solution: The following are the features of UAV networks - d. Mesh or star networks e. Multi-tasking f. Large coverage area. See lecture 19 (UAV Networks) @ 02:43

week4.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Frequently change in network topology is a benefit of UAV networks.
week4.solution: Frequently change in network topology an issue of UAV networks. See lecture 19 (UAV Networks) @ 05:29

week4.question: Which of the following is NOT a feature of multi-UAV system?
week4.solution: Following are some of the features of multi-UAV system - a. Low failures b. High scalability c. High survivability d. High cost. See lecture 19 (UAV Networks) @ 07:53

week4.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: M2M communications are free of any human intervention.
week4.solution: M2M communications are free of any human intervention. See lecture 20 (Machine to Machine Communication) @ 05:44

week4.question: Which of the following is NOT an M2M node type?
week4.solution: M2M node types are as follows - a. Low End Node b. Mid End Node c. High End Node. See lecture 20 (Machine to Machine Communication) @ 10:43

week4.question: What is the full form of M2SP in the context of Machine-to-Machine Communication?
week4.solution: M2SP stands for M2M Service Platform. See lecture 20 (Machine to Machine Communication) @ 16:31

week4.question: The ___ provides integrated services based on device collected data-sets.
week4.solution: The M2M Application Platform provides integrated services based on device collected data-sets. See lecture 20 (Machine to Machine Communication) @ 18:00

week5.question: Which of the following is/are current challenge/challenges in IoT?
week5.solution: Current challenges in IoT are a. Large scale of co-operation b. Global heterogeneity c. Unknown IoT device configuration d. Semantic conflicts. See lecture 21 (Interoperability in Internet of Things) @ 03:41.

week5.question: When two IoT devices wish to communicate, semantic conflict in such a scenario in IoT interoperability refers to
options: Two devices built by the same manufacturer
Two devices having different processing and business logic
Two devices sensing the same physical parameter
Two devices having different deployment location
week5.correctAnswer: Two devices having different processing and business logic
week5.solution: Semantic conflict refers to when different IoT devices have different processing and business execution logic. Refer Lecture 21@5:32

week5.question: Which of the following issues needs to be addressed while solving user interoperability?
week5.solution: All of the options given should be addressed while solving user interoperability issues. Refer Lecture 21@15:16.

week5.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: UMB core interoperability component is responsible for converting physical devices into virtually abstracted ones.
week5.solution: UMB-A is responsible for converting physical devices into virtually abstracted ones. (Please refer Lecture 21 @27:16)

week5.question: What is the full form of UMB in IoT interoperability?
week5.solution: UMB stands for Universal Middleware Bridge. Refer Lecture 21@22:16.

week5.question: Which of the following is NOT a function available in the Servo library for Arduino ?
week5.solution: The following are NOT functions of the Servo library for Arduino a. kill() b. destroy() c. burn(). The Refer Lecture 25@18:08.

week5.question: Arduino UNO Board is open source?
week5.solution: An Arduino UNO board is an open source electronic programmable board. Refer Lecture 22@05:21.

week5.question: Arduino Uno board accepts which type of input/inputs?
week5.solution: Arduino UNO board accepts analog and digital signals as input. Refer Lecture 22@05:21

week5.question: Arduino boards are based on which of the following microcontroller/microcontrollers.
week5.solution: Arduino board are based on the following microcontrollers - a. ATMEGA328 b. ATMEGA32u4 c. ATMEGA2560 d. AT91SAM3X8E. Refer Lecture 22@06:20

week5.question: What is the clock speed of the Arduino Uno board?
week5.solution: The clock speed of Arduino Uno board is 16MHz. Refer Lecture 22 @ 07:13.

week5.question: What must be inserted in the place of ?? within the second pinMode() function in void setup()? ... pinMode(g,?? ); ...
week5.solution: Since pin 'g' is writing digital values, it is required to set in OUTPUT mode. Refer Lecture 22-23.

week5.question: The "Verify" option in the Arduino IDE checks the code for
week5.solution: The "Verify" option in the Arduino IDE checks the code for compilation errors. Refer Lecture 24.

week5.question: How many pins does the DHT Digital Humidity and Temperature sensor have?
week5.solution: DHT Digital Humidity and Temperature sensor has 4 pins. See lecture 24 @ 03:23

week5.question: What is the function of the delay() function in an Arduino program?
options: Introduces a delay for the specified time
week5.correctAnswer: Introduces a delay for the specified time
week5.solution: The delay() function introduces a delay in the operation of the microcontroller for the specified duration. See lecture 24 @13:51

week5.question: What does the following code snippet do? Servo myservo;
options: Creates a variable to store the sensor value
Instructs the sensor to sense data
Creates an instance of servo to use it in the Arduino sketch
week5.correctAnswer: Creates an instance of servo to use it in the Arduino sketch
week5.solution: The code snipped "Servo myservo;" creates an instance of servo to use in the Arduino sketch. Refer Lecture 25 @5:32

week6.question: Python can only be used to build small applications.
week6.solution: With open-source nature, python forms a strong backbone to build large applications. (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING- I @ 3:46)

week6.question: Which of the following is NOT a Python IDE?
week6.solution: Spyder and PyCharm are examples of Python IDE. (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING- I @ 05:12)

week6.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: To indicate different blocks of code, python follows rigid indention.
week6.solution: To indicate different blocks of code, python follows rigid indention (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING- I @ 07:25).

week6.question: Which of the following is not a data-type in Python?
week6.solution: The data-types in python are a. List b. Tuple c. Dictionary (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING- I @ 15:20).

week6.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Python allows us to read and write files.
week6.solution: Python allows us to read and write files. (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING- II @ 01:17)

week6.question: Which of the following is NOT a mode to open a file?
week6.solution: The four basic modes to open a file in python are a. Read mode b. Write mode c. Append mode d. Both read and write mode (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING- II @ 03:00)

week6.question: State whether the following command to install the PIL library in Linux is correct or not. sudo pip install pillow
week6.solution: The command to install the PIL library is sudo pip install pillow. (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING- II @ 17:40)

week6.question: State whether the following statement is correct for creating a socket 's' in python. s = socket.socket(socket_family, socket_type, protocol=0)
week6.solution: The statement s = socket.socket(socket_family, socket_type, protocol=0) creates a socket in python. (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING- II @24:27).

week6.question: What is a Raspberry Pi?
week6.solution: Raspberry pi is a. A computer on your palm b. Single board computer c. Low cost d. Easy to access (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO RASPBERRY PI-I @05:00).

week6.question: Which of the following are required for a basic set up of Raspberry Pi?
week6.solution: The following are required for a basic set up of Raspberry Pi - a. Monitor b. Keyboard c. Mouse. See lecture INTRODUCTION TO RASPBERRY PI-I @ 11:33

week6.question: Which of the following keyboard key combination writes (i.e saves) the code to the file in nano editor ?
week6.solution: Ctrl+O writes the code to the file in nano editor. See lecture INTRODUCTION TO RASPBERRY PI-II @ 10:44

week6.question: A relay module for Raspberry Pi has how many terminals ?
week6.solution: A relay module for Raspberry Pi has 3 terminals. See lecture IMPLEMENTATION OF IOT WITH RASPBERRY PI-I @ 06:01.

week6.question: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Adafruit provides a library to work with the DHT22 sensor.
week6.solution: Adafruit provides a library to work with the DHT22 sensor. See lecture IMPLEMENTATION OF IOT WITH RASPBERRY PI-I @ 09:19

week6.question: What is the function of the close() function in python programming while handling files.
options: This function does not exist in python
It closes the current connection to the file and ensures that the file is free to use for other resources
week6.correctAnswer: It closes the current connection to the file and ensures that the file is free to use for other resources
week6.solution: The close() function in python ensures that the file is free to use for other resources. (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON PROGRAMMING-II @ 4:44)

week6.question: Where is the Raspbian image found?
options: It is not available on the Internet
It is available as image file from the Raspberry Pi official website
It can only be purchased from offline vendor
week6.correctAnswer: It is available as image file from the Raspberry Pi official website
week6.solution: Raspbian image can be downloaded from the Raspberry Pi official website. (Please refer to lecture INTRODUCTION TO RASPBERYY PI-I @ 12:32)

week7.question: DHT Sensor refers to Digital Humidity and Temperature Sensor.
week7.solution: DHT Sensor refers to Digital Humidity and Temperature Sensor. (Please refer to lecture Implementation of IoT with Raspberry Pi- II @ 3:28)

week7.question: Fill in the blanks. ___ is a python library used for plotting the data in 2D.
week7.solution: Matplotlib is a python library used for plotting the data in 2D. (Please refer to lecture Implementation of IoT with Raspberry Pi- III @ 12:13)

week7.question: Fill in the blanks. ___ makes a scatter plot of the given points.
week7.solution: Scatter() makes a scatter plot of the given points. (Please refer to lecture Implementation of IoT with Raspberry Pi- III @ 23:25).

week7.question: What are the two main challenges of SDN?
week7.solution: Rule placement and Controller placement are the two main challenges of SDN. (Please refer to lecture Software Defined Networking- Part-I @ 16:49)

week7.question: In soft-timeout, all the rules are deleted from the switch.
week7.solution: In soft-timeout, if no flow is received associated with a rule for a particular time, the rule is deleted. In hard-timeout, all rules are deleted from the switch. (Please refer to lecture Software Defined Networking- Part-I @ 24:57)

week7.question: Which of the following is a component of SDN?
week7.solution: Hardware switches and Flow rules are both the components of SDN. (Please refer to lecture Software Def ined Networking- Part-I @ 15.47)

week7.question: What is introduced if a controller is down in SDN?
week7.solution: Backup controller is introduced if a controller is down in SDN. (Please refer to lecture Software Defined Networking- Part- II @ 8:29)

week7.question: Southbound API is used to communicate between control layer and application layer.
week7.solution: Southbound API is used to communicate between control layer and infrastructure layer. (Please refer to lecture 34 Software Defined Networking- Part-II @1:41).

week7.question: SDN is OpenFlow.
week7.solution: SDN is not OpenFlow. It is a technology/concept. (Please refer to lecture 33 Software Defined Networking- Part-I @25:55).

week7.question: Which of the following forwards the sensed data based on the ID of the source node?
week7.solution: ID-centric data forwarding forwards the sensed data based on the ID of the source node. See lecture 35 @ 9:50

week7.question: Does integrating SDN in IoT provide intelligent routing decisions?
week7.solution: Integrating SDN in IoT provides intelligent routing decisions. See lecture 35 @ 17:25

week7.question: Are Indigo and LINC Open source?
week7.solution: Indigo and LINC are both open source. See lecture 33@ 26:43.

week7.question: Which of the following is used to communicate among multiple controllers in the control layer?
week7.solution: East-Westbound APIs are used to communicate among multiple controllers in the control layer. See lecture 34 @ 02:39

week7.question: How many requests can a controller handle through a single thread?
week7.solution: A controller can handle 200 requests in a second through a single thread. (Please refer to lecture 34@ 3:47)

week7.question: Size of the ternary content-addressable memory is not limited at the switches.
week7.solution: Size of the ternary content-addressable memory is limited at the switches (Please refer to lecture 33 @ 20:41)

week8.question: Which of these is used for efficient base-station coordination for addressing inter-cell interference?
week8.solution: Logically centralized control is used for efficient base-station coordination for addressing inter-cell interference (Please refer Lecture 36@3:02)

week8.question: Which of these takes last k-th location instances to predict the next location in Mobi-Flow?
week8.solution: Order-K Markov predictor takes last k-th location instances to predict the next location in Mobi-Flow. (Please refer Lecture 36@15:52)

week8.question: What are the two components of ODIN?
week8.solution: Odin agent and master are the two components of ODIN. (Please refer Lecture 36@10:16)

week8.question: Which of the following is placed to deal with mice-flows?
week8.solution: Wild card rules can be placed to deal with mice-flows. (Please refer Lecture 36 @18:23)

week8.question: Fill in the blank. ___ refers to heterogeneous computing nodes distributed over a wide area to perform very large tasks.
week8.solution: Grid Computing refers to heterogeneous computing nodes distributed over a wide area to perform very large tasks. (Please refer Lecture 37 @6:48)

week8.question: Which of the following is a property of cloud computing?
week8.solution: On-demand network access, high level generalization of computation and on-demand services are some of the properties of cloud computing. (Please refer Lecture 37@12:43)

week8.question: Which of the following statements are true about the different types of cloud? Statement I: Inter-cloud is a global cloud of clouds. Statement II: Volunteer cloud is a type of distributed cloud. Statement III: Public cloud has low security.
week8.solution: All the three statements are correct for the cloud. Inter-cloud is a global cloud of clouds. Volunteer cloud is a type of distributed cloud. And also Public cloud has low security. (Please refer Lecture 37@31:11, 32: 43, 32: 25)

week8.question: Fill in the blank. ___ means independent of device or location.
week8.solution: Ubiquitous means independent of device or location. (Please refer Lecture 37@18:06)

week8.question: Fill in the blank. ___ represents the on-demand delivery of computing infrastructure in the cloud.
week8.solution: Infrastructure-as-a-Service represents the on-demand delivery of computing infrastructure in the cloud. (Please refer Lecture 38@4:29)

week8.question: Fill in the blank. Hybrid cloud is a blend of ___ cloud.
week8.solution: Hybrid cloud is a blend of public and private cloud. (Please refer Lecture 38@9:50)

week8.question: Software-as-a-Service does not support a fully pay-as-you-go model.
week8.solution: Software-as-a-Service supports a fully pay-as-you-go model. (Please refer Lecture 38@13:25)

week8.question: Which of the following describes the quality of services expected by the customer?
week8.solution: Service Level Agreement describes the quality of services expected by the customer (Please refer Lecture 39@5:23)

week8.question: Which of the following are the accesses enabled by the access control layers in the cloud?
week8.solution: Service access, Server access and Database access are the accesses enabled by the access control layers in the cloud (Please refer Lecture 39@24:31)

week8.question: Reputation refers to the belief of an entity's standing by the community.
week8.solution: Reputation refers to the belief of an entity's standing by the community. (Please refer Lecture 39@25:15)

week8.question: Which of the following is true about GreenCloud?
options: GreenCloud monitors the energy consumption of servers, switches, etc.
GreenCloud was developed as an extension of NS2.
week8.solution: GreenCloud monitors the energy consumption of servers, switches, etc. It was developed as an extension of NS2. (Please refer Lecture 40@16:25)

week9.question: Which of the following is not a component of OpenStack?
week9.solution: Nova and Swift are two of the many components of OpenStack (Please refer Lecture 41@3:18)

week9.question: Where is the sensed data sent for further processing in WSNs?
week9.solution: The sensed data is sent to sink node for further processing in WSNs (Please refer Lecture 42@4:04)

week9.question: Select the statement(s) that denote the advantages of cloud computing. Statement I: Elasticity Statement II: Pay-per-use Statement III: Self Service
week9.solution: The advantages of cloud computing are Elasticity, pay-per-use and self service (Please refer Lecture 42@5:58)

week9.question: Which of the following is a limitation of WSN?
week9.solution: Price, post deployment maintenance and battery lifetime are the main limitations of WSN. (Please refer Lecture 42@11:01)

week9.question: The managerial role is played by ___ in sensor-cloud architecture.
week9.solution: Sensor-Cloud Service Provider plays the managerial role in sensor-cloud architecture. (Please refer Lecture 42@14:29)

week9.question: The optimal composition of ___ is a management issue in sensor-cloud.
week9.solution: The optimal composition of Virtual sensor nodes is a management issue in sensor-cloud. (Please refer Lecture 43@4:39)

week9.question: Who coined the term Fog computing?
week9.solution: CISCO coined the term Fog computing. (Please refer Lecture 44@4:18)

week9.question: What are the issues related to the current cloud model?
week9.solution: Volume, bandwidth and latency are some of the issues related to the current cloud model. (Please refer Lecture 44@10:30)

week9.question: Sensor data is processed in the cloud before it is sent to the fog.
week9.solution: Sensor data is processed in the fog before it is sent to the cloud. (Please refer Lecture 45@6:11)

week9.question: What is the type of received data according to which Fog nodes work?.
week9.solution: Fog nodes work according to the type of data which are very time-sensitive, less time-sensitive and non-time sensitive data. (Please refer Lecture 45@11:39)

week9.question: Which of the following are the advantages of Fog?
week9.solution: The advantages of Fog includes quick decision making, nodes can be mobile and Fog reduces the risk of latency. (Please refer Lecture 45@20:57)

week9.question: Which of the following requires the analysis at the nearest node?
week9.solution: Most time-sensitive data requires the analysis at the nearest node. (Please refer Lecture 45@15:46)

week9.question: Fog nodes cannot connect and leave the network when necessary.
week9.solution: Fog nodes can connect and leave the network when necessary. (Please refer Lecture 45@25:27)

week9.question: Which of the following is used by the fog applications to increase the speed of service accessibility?
week9.solution: Accelerators increase the speed of service accessibility. (Please refer to Page 260, Chapter 11, Introduction to IoT...)

week9.question: Fill in the blank. The concept of ___ enables physical hardware to be shared among multiple entities.
week9.solution: The concept of hardware virtualization enables physical hardware to be shared among multiple entities. (Please refer to Page 262, Chapter 11, Introduction to IoT...)

week10.question: Smart homes can be used for
week10.solution: Smart homes can be used for home monitoring, conservation of resources, security and safety. (Please refer Lecture 46@25:02)

week10.question: Which of the following is an iot challenge in smart cities?
week10.solution: Reliability, Large scale and Big data are some of the challenges of iot in smart cities. (Please refer Lecture 46@32:57)

week10.question: Select the statement(s) that are true for smart parking. Statement I: Smart parking reduces traffic congestion Statement II: Smart parking increases urban mobility Statement III: Smart parking reduces fuel consumption
week10.solution: Smart parking reduces traffic congestion and fuel consumption, and increases urban mobility (Please refer Lecture 47@16:46)

week10.question: Which of the following is a functional layer in smart parking?
week10.solution: Information Collection, System Deployment and Service Dissemination are all the functional layers in smart parking. (Please refer Lecture 47@17:24)

week10.question: The mobile sensing in smart parking collects the information
week10.solution: The mobile sensing in smart parking collects the information along the route. (Please refer Lecture 47@19:47)

week10.question: The network which provides amalgamation of various systems within a home is known as
week10.solution: The network which provides amalgamation of various systems within a home is known as Home Area Network. (Please refer Lecture 48@8:24)

week10.question: Which of the following is the correct full form of DLNA Standards for HAN?
week10.solution: DLNA stands for Digital Living Network Alliance standards. (Please refer Lecture 48@13:49)

week10.question: Which of the following is a part of ZigBee Alliance?
week10.solution: The Zigbee Alliance is composed of Mitsubishi, Honeywell, Invensys, Motorola and Philips. (Please refer Lecture 48@15:46)

week10.question: Network and Application layers are defined by IEEE 802.15.4 in Zigbee.
week10.solution: Network and Application layers are defined by Zigbee in Zigbee. (Please refer Lecture 48@16:42)

week10.question: Which of the following is a feature of Content Centric Networking?
week10.solution: Hierarchically named data, Scalable data dissemination and In-network caching are all the features of CCN. (Please refer Lecture 49@15:17)

week10.question: Which of the following is a phase of ICV development?
week10.solution: The phases of ICV development: Phase 1: Based on 2G, Phase 2: Based on 4G LTE, Phase 3: Vehicles connected to cloud (Please refer Lecture 50@12:28)

week10.question: Which of the following is a property of V2X?
week10.solution: V2X follows a distributed architecture. (Please refer Lecture 49@12:06)

week10.question: The vehicles cannot be mobile in the Ad-hoc domain of VANET.
week10.solution: The vehicles are mobile in the Ad-hoc domain of VANET.. (Please refer Lecture 50@16:59)

week10.question: Which of the following is a domain of VANET?
week10.solution: Both of the In-vehicle and Ad-hoc are the two domains of VANETS. (Please refer Lecture 50@14:36)

week10.question: Fill in the blank. ICV is based on
week10.solution: ICV is based on Dedicated Short Range Communication. (Please refer Lecture 50@7:22)

week11.question: What are some of the other names of the smart grids?
week11.solution: Smart grids are also known as Electricity with a brain, Energy internet, and Electronet. (Please refer Lecture 51@8:33)

week11.question: Traditional Grid follows which type of flow of energy?
week11.solution: Traditional grid follows unidirectional flow of energy. (Please refer Lecture 51@5:41)

week11.question: Which of the following is a benefit associated with smart grids?
week11.solution: Smart Grids provide efficient transmission of electricity, lower electricity rates and Improved security. (Please refer Lecture 51@11:26)

week11.question: Which of the following is a way of consumer engagement?
week11.solution: Net metering, Time-of-Use pricing and Financial incentives are ways of consumer engagements. (Please refer Lecture 51 @32:31)

week11.question: Fill in the blank. In ___, a home can have power from distributed resources.
week11.solution: In islanding, a home can have power from distributed resources. (Please refer Lecture 51 @31:20)

week11.question: Which of the following aggregates energy consumption of a certain geographical area?
week11.solution: Data Aggregator Units aggregates energy consumption of a certain geographical area (Please refer Lecture 52@15:03)

week11.question: Which of the following statements are true about Dynamic System Attacks? Statement I: Replay attacks compromises sensors and monitors their outputs. Statement II: D-DIA can lead to a system collapse. Statement III: Covert attack is a closed loop version of replay attacks.
week11.solution: Replay attacks compromises sensors and monitors their outputs. D-DIA can lead to a system collapse. Covert attack is a closed loop version of replay attacks. (Please refer Lecture 52@20:03)

week11.question: Fill in the blank. ___ is a centralized coordinator for smart grid communication.
week11.solution: MDMS is a centralized coordinator for smart grid communication. (Please refer Lecture 52@15:32)

week11.question: Fill in the blank. ___ are available protocols for smart home appliances.
week11.solution: C-Bus, DECT, EnOcean and Universal Powerline Bus are available protocols for smart home appliances. (Please refer Lecture 52@ 12:35)

week11.question: Fill in the blank. ___ is the time required to transmit the data.
week11.solution: Latency is the time required to transmit the data. (Please refer Lecture 53@21:20)

week11.question: IIoT is based on Wrap & Replace approach.
week11.solution: IIoT is based on wrap & re-use approach. (Please refer Lecture 53@9:53)

week11.question: Which of the following happened in the 3rd Revolution?
week11.solution: Internet evolution and automation happened in the 3rd Revolution. (Please refer Lecture 53@10:06)

week11.question: Which of the following is used to improve the interoperability of different systems?
week11.solution: Standardization improves the interoperability of different systems. (Please refer Lecture 54@16:09)

week11.question: Big data is characterized by 7 Vs.
week11.solution: Big data is characterized by 7 Vs. (Please refer Lecture 55@10:36)

week11.question: What is Hadoop used in?
week11.solution: Hadoop is used for distributed processing of large datasets across Large clusters of computers (Please refer Lecture 55@23:18)

week12.question: The two types of data analysis are
week12.solution: Qualitative and Quantitative are the two types of data analysis. (Please refer Lecture 56@2:33)

week12.question: Which of the following is a principle of Qualitative analysis.
week12.solution: The three principles of Qualitative analysis are: Notice things, think about things and collect things. (Please refer Lecture 56@4:12)

week12.question: Select the statement(s) that is involved with quantitative analysis. Statement I: Data dispersion Statement II: Contingence Statement III: Correlation
week12.solution: Data dispersion, Contingence and Correlation are involved with quantitative analysis. (Please refer Lecture 56@4:46)

week12.question: Which of the following is a type of data dispersion?
week12.solution: Range and average absolute deviation are the type of data dispersions. (Please refer Lecture 56@13:43)

week12.question: In ANOVA, if the distribution of each group is normal, it is known as
week12.solution: In ANOVA, if the distribution of each group is normal, it is known as normality. (Please refer Lecture 56@11:01)

week12.question: The expectation of the squared deviation of a random variable from its mean is known as
week12.solution: The expectation of the squared deviation of a random variable from its mean is known as Variance. (Please refer Lecture 56@14:04)

week12.question: What are the two types of statistical models?
week12.solution: Complete and incomplete are two types of statistical models (Please refer Lecture 56@8:11)

week12.question: Which of the following is a type of table that displays the frequency distribution of the variables?
week12.solution: Contingency table is a type of table that displays the frequency distribution of the variables. It is also known as Cross tabulation and Cross tab. (Please refer Lecture 56@14:29)

week12.question: Advances in sensor and connectivity have enabled preventive care in IoT Healthcare.
week12.solution: Advances in sensor and connectivity have enabled preventive care in IoT Healthcare. (Please refer Lecture 58@4:22)

week12.question: Which of the following is an application of IoT in Agriculture?.
week12.solution: Automated irrigation system, Automated weeding system and Water level monitoring are all applications of IoT in agriculture. (Please refer Lecture 57@2:05)

week12.question: Which of the following is a property of in-place data analysis?
week12.solution: In-place data analysis is power intensive, can be done on the device and needs no network connection. (Please refer Lecture 59@20:24)

week12.question: Which of the following is the advantage of activity monitoring?
week12.solution: Long term monitoring is one of the advantages of Activity monitoring. (Please refer Lecture 59@16:17)

week12.question: Deep learning based data analysis cannot be performed on sensor data.
week12.solution: Deep learning based data analysis can be done on sensor data, images and videos. (Please refer Lecture 59@19:34)

week12.question: Which of the following is true for network-based data analysis?
week12.solution: Network-based data analysis uses low power, good network connection and can perform group-based analytics (Please refer Lecture 59@20:10)

week12.question: Which of the following is an advantage of continuous activity monitoring?
week12.solution: Daily observation of behavior and Long term monitoring are two advantages of continuous activity monitoring. (Please refer Lecture 59@16:15)
